policies.involuntary_refund:
Your request is eligible under Africa World Airlines' refund policy for involuntary schedule changes.

If your flight was canceled or rescheduled and you do not accept the new flight option:
• A full refund is permitted.
• Please ensure all flight segments are canceled to avoid a no-show.
• When reissuing, include the following text in the ENDO BOX:
  → INV REF NO FLT#/DATE-CXL

Note: Refunds and rebooking are only applicable if the cancellation was not caused by extraordinary circumstances (e.g., weather or security disruptions).
policies.involuntary_reissue:
Your request is eligible under Africa World Airlines' reissue policy for involuntary schedule changes.

If your flight was canceled or rescheduled and you accept the new flight option:
• The ticket may be reissued without penalty.
• No waiver code is required.
• Enter the following text in the ENDO BOX:
  → INVOL SKCHG

If the new flight option is declined:
• You may protect the passenger on a preferred flight with the same route and inventory.
• If no alternative is available, please escalate to Sales Support for further assistance.

policies.medical_refund: Africa World Airlines does not require a waiver code for involuntary reissues or refunds. Reissues use ENDO BOX: “INVOL SKCHG” and refunds use “INV REF NO FLT#/DATE-CXL”. All other changes are subject to fare rules and applicable change fees unless otherwise approved in writing.
policies.name_change:
Africa World Airlines does not support name corrections.

If the name on the ticket is incorrect:
• The ticket must be refunded (penalty applies).
• A new ticket must be issued with the correct name.
policies.group_booking:
Group fares are available for parties of 10 or more passengers.
• A 25% non-refundable deposit is required to secure the booking.
• Final payment and passenger names are required by the deadline advised by AWA.
• Group seats are non-refundable once finalized.
• Changes to group size may impact pricing.
policies.infant_policy:
Infants under 2 years of age are eligible for infant fares.
• A birth certificate or photo ID must be presented at check-in.
• Each infant may carry up to 10 kg of baggage.
• No more than two infants are permitted per accompanying adult.
• Sick infants require a doctor’s certificate to fly.
policies.baggage_policy:
Checked baggage allowance is defined by fare class and appears on your ticket. Delayed baggage will be tracked for 21 days. If not located, it is declared lost and compensated accordingly.
• Claims require a damage report at the airport.
• AWA does not accept liability for fragile items, electronics, or valuables unless declared.
• Maximum compensation per international trip is 1,131 SDRs (Montreal Convention); for Ghana domestic flights, up to USD $1000.
• Depreciation tables apply based on item type and age.

To report baggage issues, visit the AWA baggage desk or call 054 011 5196.
policies.seat_request_policy:
Africa World Airlines offers assistance for passengers with reduced mobility (WCHR only).
• CRT agents are available at the airport for support.
• Wheelchairs are free of charge.
• Special seat requests are assigned at check-in and may be adjusted for operational needs.
• Emergency exit row seating is not available to passengers requiring special assistance.
policies.short_term_cancellation_policy: Africa World Airlines does not explicitly offer a same-day void or 24-hour cancellation policy. All changes must comply with the fare rules and may be subject to penalties. Please contact AWA or your issuing agent immediately for any correction or cancellation needs.
